results.title: Willy Wonka and the chocolate factory [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Wolper Productions, Quaker Oats Company, Stan Margulies, David L. Wolper and Mel Stuart
results.brief_description: This funny and inventive screenplay by Roald Dahl is based upon his best-seller “Charlie and the Chocolate Factory.” Gene Wilder is at his zany best as Willy Wonka, owner of a world-famous sweet factory who offers the fabulous prize of a tour of his extraordinary premises to five lucky children. However, when the winners arrive to claim their reward, they are caught up in a series of incredible and exciting adventures as Willy Wonka tests their honesty. The Academy Award nominated soundtrack includes the hit “Candy Man”.

results.title: Wills and Burke: The Untold Story
results.creator_credit: Stony Desert, Bob Weis and Margot McDonald
results.brief_description: Comic recreation of explorers Burke & Wills and their ill-fated expedition to cross Australia in 1860. Setting out with 28 camels and 4 camel drivers, they were two-thirds through the journey when the expedition was completely without food and almost out of tea. Public enthusiasm remained high for Burke & Wills and the expedition from which they did not return. Starring Gary McDonald and Kim Gyngell.

results.title: William Shakespeare's A Midsummer Night's Dream
results.creator_credit: Fox Searchlight Pictures, Regency Enterprises, Leslie Urdang and Michael Hoffman
results.brief_description: A stellar cast headed by Michelle Pfeiffer and Kevin Kline, bring Shakespeare’s capering romantic comedy to life. When two pairs of star-crossed lovers, a feuding pair of supernatural sprites (Titania and Oberon), and a love potion gone awry all come together in an enchanted moonlit forest, the result is a delightful mix of merriment and magic. Cast also includes Calista Flockhart, Stanley Tucci and Rupert Everett.

results.title: Wilde
results.creator_credit: Samuelson Entertainment, INDF International, Marc Samuelson, Peter Samuelson and Brian Gilbert
results.brief_description: In this world there are only two tragedies. One is not getting what one wants, and the other is getting it (Oscar Wilde). Stephen Fry stars as Oscar Wilde, one of the most controversial writers of our time. A man brimming with wit and honesty, but a life tragically plagued by scandal. This video traces the rise and fall of Oscar, including; his relationship with Lord Alfred Douglas, “Bosie” (Jude Law), and the loving relationships he had with his devoted wife, Constance (Jennifer Ehle) and two children, and his publicized trial and imprisonment. What emerges is a portrait of a man of incredible literary talent, fierce love and passion, loved by those of whom he gave his affection but ultimately denigrated by conservative society for his perceived amoral and hedonistic lifestyle.

results.title: Wild things
results.creator_credit: Mandalay Entertainment, Rodney Liber, Steven A Jones and John McNaughton
results.brief_description: Wild Things is a steamy thriller about two high school students, the guidance counsellor they accuse of rape, and the detective who suspects there’s more to the story. This mystery of deceit, sex, greed and power moves from Blue Bay’s elite beach communities into the murky swampy waters of the Everglades at a rapid pace with unpredictable plot twists abundant. Cast includes: Kevin Bacon, Matt Dillon, Neve Campbell, Theresa Russell, Robert Wagner and Bill Murray.

results.title: Wild strawberries
results.creator_credit: Svensk Filmindustri, Allan Ekelund and Ingmar Bergman
results.brief_description: Wild Strawberries is justifiably considered a classic Ingmar Bergman film. Isak Borg (Victor Sjostrom) is 78 and about to be honoured by the University of Lund for his services to medicine. He decides to drive to Lund with his daughter-in-law Marianne (Ingrid Thulin). The film follows the events of the day as he remembers scenes from the past, has bouts of troubling dreams, and meets up with a group of young travellers. Victor Sjostrom is marvelous as the rigid professor who is touched by the warmth of the people who he encounters on this pivotal day. This edition comes with Ingmar Bergman’s screenplay, which gives a fascinating insight into Bergman’s narrative skills, and includes a run-down of the cutting continuity for those interested in the techniques of film-making. In Swedish with English subtitles.

results.title: Wild reeds = Les Roseaux sauvages
results.creator_credit: Ima Films, Les Films Alain Sarde, Canal+, Alain Sarde, Georges Benayoun and Andre Techine
results.brief_description: It is 1962 and at a boarding school in rural France two young men from vastly different worlds - Francois is an urban intellectual and Serge is a farmer’s son - begin a tentative friendship. Both boys find themselves attracted to Maite, their school teacher’s daughter, but Francois must also deal with the first awakening of homosexual desire for his best friend. Their innocence is shattered by the arrival of the Algerian born Henri who brings with him the militant racist anger of the colonial expatriate, an anger he directs against his fellow school mates and towards the Communist sympathising Maite. Techine’s “Wild reeds” is possibly the defining work of French cinema at the end of the twentieth century. In setting his story in the early sixties, Techine is both acknowledging the debt owed to the Nouvelle Vague (in particular to Truffaut), as well as firmly establishing through his mise-en-scene his debt to the older, neglected French tradition of directors such as Renoir, Carne and Clair. Even though the film itself is vastly enjoyable as a narrative of adolescent rites of passage, it can also be read as an attempt to re-interrogate the cultural and historical legacy of French decolonisation and of the generation of 1968; the generation whose work and ideologies were to overwhelm French cinema and aesthetics for over two decades. “Wild reeds”, like “La haine”, “World without pity” and “Irma Vep”, is a sign of the renewal of French cinema - the exploration of new terrain and the possible reconciliation of past struggles and disruptions. This is a wonderful film. The outstanding cinematography is by Jeanne Lapoirie. The cast include Elodie Bouchez, Gael Morel, Stephane Rideau and Frederic Gorny. (Awards: Winner of the Cesar for Best Film and Best Director, 1995)

results.title: Wild in the country
results.creator_credit: Twentieth Century-Fox Film Corporation, Jerry Wald and Philip Dunne
results.brief_description: Elvis Presley plays troubled and angry local boy Glenn Talbot in this 1960’s adaptation of J.R. Salamanca’s novel “Wild in the Country”. The movie opens with Glenn and his brother brawling and the fight lands Glenn in front of the probation board yet again. The board gives him a second chance on the condition he is given into the custody of his Uncle and attends sessions with local psychologist Irene Spencer (Hope Lange). Glenn battles against his temper and old wild ways with the help of Irene who encourages him to pursue his writing and helps him get into college. The pair, high on Glenn’s success and sheltering from a storm in a motel, declare their love, but contain their desire for one another. Fearful of her feelings towards Glenn, Irene spurns his love by agreeing to marry another; Glenn, enraged by the news goes on a drunken spree and looks to be reverting back to his wicked ways. Cast also includes Tuesday Weld, Millie Perkins, John Ireland and Rafer Johnson.

results.title: WHO: The kids are alright
results.creator_credit: BMG Music, Bill Curbishley, Tony Klinger and Jeff Stein
results.brief_description: Features live performances of the Who’s most celebrated hits from “My generation” to the sophistication of the rock opera “Tommy”. Along with the guitar-smashing exuberance of the group’s stage performances, director Jeff Stein has assembled a series of interviews which reflect the collective and individual nature of the band.
